page.title: 17Nature Walk to the Castle.
page.content: It was a very boring morning, but it brightened up when our teacher said we were going to{Hadleigh Castle}for a nature walk.After a chat, we set off in a crocodile-that means walking 2 by 2.When we came to the end of the road, excitement bubbled because we could begin searching under the hedgerows. Our teacher called it a"mini-habitat". We caught all kinds of mini-beasts like{beetles,bush crickets,wood lice, {slugs, snails and a glowworm.}We made our way down to the castle through the kissing-gate where we fed the horses. When we reached the castle, we did some rubbings of the stones and sketched some pictures for fifteen minutes. Some children rolled down the hill! On our way back, we picked wild flowers and interesting leaves. It was starting to rain on our return. Back at school we sorted our collection.
